alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Northern Lycoming; Southern Lycoming; Sullivan (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:33AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL LYCOMING...NORTH CENTRAL COLUMBIA AND CENTRAL SULLIVAN COUNTIES THROUGH 130 AM EDT... At 1233 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles southwest of Wyalusing to 22 miles northwest of Bloomsburg to near Montoursville to Williamsport. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Williamsport, Montoursville, Muncy, Hughesville, Jamison City, Waller, Lairdsville, Ricketts Glen State Park, Central, Fairmount Spgs, Biggertown, Muncy Valley, Loyalsockville, South Williamsport, Picture Rocks, Laporte, Eagles Mere, Williamsport Airport and Little League World Series Complex. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
